q: the suggestion of bankruptcy protection. California Treasurer Bill Lockyer told Reuters Insider Monday that states may not need the same freedom to declare bankruptcy as major companies because they have a guaranteed source of revenue. The major difference, of course, is that we're looking at sovereign governments that have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with, he said. We- because he was just, " Gabrielle Giffords , can you see me, can you see me?" And that love was so palpable. [...] A visit to Tunisia by defence secretary Donald Rumsfeld in February 2006 proves even more revealing: "We have a very long relationship with Tunisia," Donald Rumsfeld remarked after the meetings. Tunisia is a moderate Muslim nation that has been and is today providing very constructive leadership in the world. The struggle that's taking place within that faith is a serious one, an important one. There's a very small number of violent extremists on the one side against a broad, overwhelming majority of people who are moderate. Meanwhile former News of the World journalist Paul McMullan told MPs that he believed Andy Coulson , the former No 10 director of communications who quit over the scandal last month, must have known about phone-hacking. The real scandal is David Cameron would have been briefed: "We can probably get away with this one,' when hiring Andy Coulson , so Mr David Cameron is either a liar or an idiot, he wrote. do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the Government." Mr David Cameron made clear he had "full confidence" in Mr Andy Coulson and had not pushed him out. He said: During his time working for me, Andy Coulson has carried out his role with complete professionalism. He has been a brilliant member of my team and has thrown himself at the job with skill and dedication. Scotland Yard inquiry into phone hacking ended with the 2007 conviction and jailing of Glenn Mulcaire , a private investigator working for the paper. In 1969, Donald Rumsfeld hired Bill Bradley as a summer intern at the OEO at a time when his fellow Princeton graduate was starting his career with the New York Knicks. He'll be a Republican before the summer is out, Donald Rumsfeld predicted-wrongly, as he must have remembered when he wrote a check for$ 1,000 to Bill Bradley 's recent campaign for the Democratic nomination for Richard Nixon .
